item.title: Microsoft: Exchange 2016 and 2019 reach end of support in six months
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft warned that Exchange 2016 and Exchange 2019 will reach the end of support six months from now, on October 14. [...]

item.title: Google adds Android auto-reboot to block forensic data extractions
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Google is rolling out a new security mechanism on Android devices that will automatically reboot locked, unused devices after three consecutive days of inactivity, restoring memory to an encrypted state. [...]

item.title: Microsoft warns of CPU spikes when typing in classic Outlook
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft warned Windows users of increased CPU usage when typing while using recent versions of the classic Outlook email client. [...]

item.title: Hertz confirms customer info, drivers' licenses stolen in data breach
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Car rental giant Hertz Corporation warns it suffered a data breach after customer data for its Hertz, Thrifty, and Dollar brands was stolen in the Cleo zero-day data theft attacks. [...]

item.title: Govtech giant Conduent confirms client data stolen in January cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: American business services giant and government contractor Conduent disclosed today that client data was stolen in a January 2025 cyberattack. [...]

item.title: Cybersecurity firm buying hacker forum accounts to spy on cybercriminals
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Swiss cybersecurity firm Prodaft has launched a new initiative called 'Sell your Source' where the company purchases verified and aged accounts on hacking forums to to spy on cybercriminals. [...]

item.title: SSL/TLS certificate lifespans reduced to 47 days by 2029
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The CA/Browser Forum has voted to significantly reduce the lifespan of SSL/TLS certificates over the next 4 years, with a final lifespan of just 47 days starting in 2029. [...]

item.title: New ResolverRAT malware targets pharma and healthcare orgs worldwide
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new remote access trojan (RAT) called 'ResolverRAT' is being used against organizations globally, with the malware used in recent attacks targeting the healthcare and pharmaceutical sectors. [...]

item.title: Meta to resume AI training on content shared by Europeans
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Meta announced today that it will soon start training its artificial intelligence models using content shared by European adult users on its Facebook and Instagram social media platforms. [...]

item.title: Kidney dialysis firm DaVita hit by weekend ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Kidney dialysis firm DaVita disclosed Monday it suffered a weekend ransomware attack that encrypted parts of its network and impacted some of its operations. [...]

item.title: Enhancing your DevSecOps with Wazuh, the open source XDR platform
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Wazuh
item.description: Security shouldn't wait until the end of development. Wazuh brings real-time threat detection, compliance, and vulnerability scanning into your DevOps pipeline—powering a stronger DevSecOps strategy from day one. Learn more about how Wazuh can help secure your development cycle. [...]

item.title: Microsoft tells Windows users to ignore 0x80070643 WinRE errors
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft says some users might see 0x80070643 installation failures when trying to deploy the April 2025 Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) updates. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: New Windows updates fix Active Directory policy issues
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has released emergency Windows updates to address a known issue affecting local audit logon policies in Active Directory Group Policy. [...]

item.title: OpenAI's GPT-4.1, 4.1 nano, and 4.1 mini models release imminent
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: According to references spotted on OpenAI's website, the Microsoft-backed AI startup is planning to launch five new models this week, including GPT-4.1, 4.1 nano, and 4.1 mini. [...]
